Node.gloss: to envy|to be envious|to be jealous of (someone else)
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= to experience a desire to see something happen or to do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil
particle linking two entities and denoting that X and Y function as one single entity in the proposition in focus
= action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= causative action by which humans or deities bring an object into existence
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building
= state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live
= state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable
= state in which a person or object has qualities that inspire love and appreciation
primarily found in poetic contexts: = human being; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= state in which a person, supernatural being, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= process by which humans summon their physical strength to accomplish a particular goal
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue of humans in need
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action by which humans or animals open their mouth ► in order to speak
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way
= person engaged in a certain activity
= plan or strategy thought out by humans or deities to accomplish a certain goal; ≈ when used for humans, only used in a negative sense
literally: to cry out; hence: = action by which humans or deities assign a name to a person, place, object, or phenomenon
literally: plan; hence: = a state of moral and ethical corruption, starting with evil plans and resulting in depraved practices, ≈ regarded as foolishness
= state of being regarded as foolish, ◄ because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= people, animals, and inanimate objects that are considered utterly wrong and detestable, because of their condition, their behavior, or because of certain customs
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= state in which a certain quality is small in intensity
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= causative action by which humans or deities remove (other) humans or objects from a dangerous or life threatening situation
= process by which humans or animals stop living
= the killing of people in a cruel and violent way

Node.gloss: if only ... (I would be so happy!)
Node.definition: = particle marking an event that one wishes to happen
= causative action by which humans or deities keep (other) humans from performing a particular event

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: to repay|to pay back|to punish|to reward
Node.definition: literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility
= state in which objects are of a high quality and/or a pleasure to look at
= virgin honey (דְּבַשׁ) dripping straight from the honeycomb; ≈ regarded as very desirable food of high quality
= state in which food tastes well
= process by which humans discover the flavor of food; ≈ associated with the palate
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
literally: to find (a certain condition); hence: = process by which humans eventually reach a certain state or condition
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion

= state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
literally: to cut off (an event); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause an event to stop happening

Node.gloss: to lie in wait|to lay an ambush|to lurk
Node.definition: = to go to a location where one will not be readily seen by others; ► and wait there for an opportunity to seize or attack someone or do something else that is supposed to be done when nobody else can witness it
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= place where animals lie down to rest
= state in which a countable entity is seven in number
= process by which humans or animals lose their balance while walking or standing and end up flat on the ground; ≈ associated with failure and loss of face
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them
= state of hardship or difficulty in a circumstance, sometimes as the consequence of wicked behavior
= process by which humans or animals lose their balance while walking or standing and end up flat on the ground; ≈ associated with failure and loss of face
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
literally: to stumble; hence: = process by which humans do not live up to the expectations others have of them
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

literally: to be wrong or bad in the eyes (of someone); hence = state in which certain actions or patterns of behavior are considered bad or evil by (other) humans or deities, ► which often provokes them to anger

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: to cause (an event) to turn away (from someone else); hence: = action by which deities cause a condition in which they are personally involved to come to an end
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= process by which humans or deities experience extreme displeasure, ◄ described as an internal fire

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way

Node.gloss: to envy|to be envious|to be jealous of (someone else)
Node.definition: = process by which humans experience a sentiment of anger with regard to someone else, ◄ because that other person has qualities, privileges, or possessions that one feels one should have as well, or because that person lavishes favors on another party that one feels should be directed to oneself
= pertaining to being the last part of an event, close to its moment of completion
= condition of a human or a spirit that is not considered morally good or pure or right; can refer to an individual, a group, or a nation

= small container ◄ made out of earthenware, ► filled with oil (שֶׁמֶן) and with a wick (פִּשְׁתָּה) placed in it; sometimes placed on a lampstand (מְנֹורָה) used as a source of light (אֹור) ≈ associated with peace, stability and well being
= process by which a fire or light is put out; ≈ associated with the beginning of difficult times, and sometimes even death
= title used to address a person (male if in singular) who is regarded with some degree of affection, ◄ as if he were the speaker's child

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= action by which humans join in or associate other humans; used to describe the combinations of different groups of peoples, suggesting social and religious confusion
= extremely difficult circumstances ► resulting in grief, poverty, sickness, and/or death
= state in which a countable entity is two in number

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
= action with which humans favor one side in a dispute over the other
= event where a dispute between two parties is settle by a judge
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

= causative action by which humans or deities consign humans to death, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

= causative action by which deities or humans consign someone or something to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language
literally: to judge; hence: = action by which humans or deities inflict a penalty on others as retribution for what they have done
= state in which humans are in a condition of well being
= action by which deities grant a special favor to humans, objects, and events, or by which humans invoke a deity to do the same
= state in which events are well performed, morally and ethically correct, and beneficial to others

= action with which a person touches her or his lips to another person (usually on the lips or cheek or hand) or to an object ► to show love or respect or devotion; also used when greeting and saying goodbye
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation
literally: to establish; hence: = causative actions by which humans bring a process to completion
= area outside of town; ► used for farming

Node.gloss: to make preparations|to make things ready
Node.definition: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which humans perform all events that are necessary or required

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= referent to the time after the event in focus
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made
= action by which someone performs an event without any argument, cause, or reason that could possibly explain or justify it
= someone with whom a person has some level of association, for example, by geography, social or ethnic grouping, personal connection, or temporary circumstance
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation

Node.gloss: to lure|to allure|to entice|to coax|to persuade|to seduce|to flatter|to trick|to deceive
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities provoke in (other) humans the will or desire to do something

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

Node.gloss: to repay|to pay back|to punish|to reward
Node.definition: literally: to send back (to someone); hence: = causative process by which humans or deities case (other) humans or deities to receive the appropriate return for their actions, which can be either good or bad

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
= state in which humans lack a particular quality that they are supposed to have
literally: heart; hence: = the ability to think for oneself as opposed to being easily swayed by what others say or do
literally: to go up; hence: = process by which an object appears on top of or over another one
= thorny plant ► considered to be a weed; ≈ associated with neglect and desolation
literally: to cover; hence: = state in which objects are present in a very great quantity
meaning unsure; possibly: = plant with thorns or another desert shrub, like nettle (|iUrtica dioica|i* or |iUrtica pilulifera|i*); ► useless; ≈ symbol of uncultivated areas

= a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin
= block of stone, whether fully square or not;◄ found in nature or hewn from a quarry; ► used for building houses, walls, and other constructions
= state in which something is in extreme disrepair ◄ caused by either neglect or destruction
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

Node.gloss: to take to heart|to be concerned about
Node.definition: literally: to put (one's) heart on (something); hence: = to process information in one's mind, often with the intention to act upon it later
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= state in which humans are asleep; ≈ sometimes associated with security, sometimes with death, sometimes with being inactive
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= state in which humans are sleeping relatively lightly; ≈ sometimes associated with being inactive
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event
= action by which humans fold their hands together, ► probably in order to rest or take a nap; ≈ associated with being idle and laziness

= the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= person who spends much time on the road, either as well intentioned traveller or as roaming vagabond
= state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God

= a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God
